intro: Wintera traversii, commonly known as the New Zealand wintera, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Winteraceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, and is often found in coastal and lowland forest habitats. Its leaves are leathery and glossy, providing a dense canopy, while its flowers bloom in late winter to early spring. Wintera traversii plays an important role in the ecological systems of its native region, supporting various pollinators and wildlife.
